1) Add potatoes to perforated hotel pans and put in rationale oven. Steam potatoes until about 85% done and a knife can be easily inserted into the potatoe with little resistance, about 15-20 minutes.
2) Carefully spread potatoes out on sheet pan to cool. Put on speed racks.
3) IF APPLICABLE---When cool, tear apart by hand in rough chunks. Reserve for making classic potato salad.---- If NOT FOR POTATO SALAD, THERE IS NO NEED TO TEAR THEM UP
4) For service, fry potatoe chunks in 350* fryer until crispy on the outside and cooked throughout, about 4 minutes. Alternatively, roast in 450*F oven until crispy, about 15-20 minutes.

Prep: - Soak Tomatillos in Warm water for half an hour - Brush through them with your hand to loosen "jackets". The more the better... - Take off all of the Tomatillos outer jackets
Pre-Oven: - Ready 2 Deep Hotel Pans for Ingredients - Half all Tomatillos to ready them for roasting - Cut Onions - Add Garlic Whole - Half Jalapenos and Serranos, Remove Stems - Set Aside All Remaining Ingredients - Oil and Salt Ingredients in Hotel Pans
Oven: - Roast for up to 30-40 minutes at 375For until caramelized - add water and cook for another 60-90 minutes - Stir Occasionally to circulate caramelized top! - Remove and Cool! - Cooling this is key to its colour. If remaining ingredients are added (namely cilantro) to a warm sauce before blending, the green will turn to brown.
Post-Cooling: - Add 6 of the 8 Bunches of the cilantro to the mixture, and blend with the Large Hand Blender / Immersion Blender. Take 3 Cups of the mixture, and add the remaining 2 bunches of cilantro to the Vitamix. Blend in the Vitamix until it is a uniform deep green mixture. Add to the remaining mixture. - Continuing with the Large Hand Blender / Immersion Blender, lime juice, and salt to taste.

Allergens: Method:
Pre-Oven - Place Remaining Ingredients in 2 Deep Hotel Pans - Oil, Salt - Toss (10 Minutes) - Roast in Convection Oven at 400F for 1.5 Hours - Stir Occasionally (Top will Caramelize) - Add Water If Necessary
Post-Oven - Add Remaining Ingredients: H20 / Vinegar - Blend Thoroughly In Vitamix (30 Minutes) - Season w/ Salt to taste - Add Vinegar
Post-Processing - Cool Down, and let Rest overnight. - Vaccuum Pack in 2L Bags - Label/Date & Freeze for future use...

- Roast all Chilis at 400F - Place Each Chili on SEPARATE Oven Pan - Anchos will be done first... - Guajillos will be done around the same time... - Chipotle will need more time - roast until almost black...
- SEED ALL CHILIS ONCE THEY'VE COOLED DOWN! - Break them open and shake out the seeds. - Keep as much of the "flesh" as possible.
- IN THE VITAMIX: - Blitz the remaining "flesh" into a powder. - Add Oil, Sugar, Salt, and Lime Juice - Using Hand Blender / Immersion Blender to Mix
- Date / Label & Store!

Portioning:

- PRE-SOAK Beans overnight! - 2 X 20L CAMBRO Containers - HALF of the Beans in Each - Filled with 12L of Water Each
- Drain Beans from their hydration liquid. Your cooking water should be different from your soaking water.
- Using the Small Steam Kettle, Cook Beans slowly in 20 extra liters of water. They should be good to start at 250F.
- Cook the beans until they are soft, but not decomposing. During the cooking process it is important to skim off the foamy protein that will accumulate at the surface of the cooking beans' water - this, if unchecked, will lead to a poor bitter taste and a lesser shelf life for the beans themselves.
- While the beans are cooking, saute your onions in Canola Oil, until dark brown. Caramelize them as far as they will go, and then add Cumin and Garlic. Saute Cumin and Garlic for 5 minutes, and then take off heat.
- Turn off Steam Kettle when the beans are cooked, and let beans sit. Take 4L of the cooking water, and set aside.
- Drain beans, and then transfer them into a neutral container greater than 40L in volume. Get the large Hand Blender / Immersion Blender.
- Add the Onion mixture with the Garlic and Cumin, as well as half of the Salt. The remaining halves - set aside, and use to SEASON TO TASTE.
- With the Hand Blender / Immersion Blender, blend about 4L of the bean mixture into a puree - and then add back into the rest of the beans, and mix. Add reserve liquid from the cooking, until you get - not a soup - beans with a puree of more beans.
- Cool, Label/Date, and Store.

Prep:
- Quarter Corn Tortillas. 2.5 Packages of Corn Tortillas will yield 2 Deep Hotel pans full of Corn Chips.
- Using Paper Towel, create a large pan or bowl for draining the excess oil off of the Tortilla Chips, after they've come out of the Deep Fryer.
- At 350 Degrees (F) in the Deep Fryer, fry NO MORE THAN HALF OF A STACK OF CORN TORTILLAS (QUARTERED) at a time.
- Using a Spider, or Long Tongs - KEEP TORTILLAS MOVING AT ALL TIMES.
- Depending on how dark the Deep Fryer oil is, fry the Tortilla Chips until they are brown (keeping in mind that they will cook for a little while longer once they've been taken out of the fryer.
- As soon as the chips are out drying, salt lightly using the Windsor coarse grain salt. The salt will only stick during this stage of production - be sure to catch it!
Label/Date/Store

- Once your Pork Butts are ready to prepare, score their tops (THE FATTY PART) with cross-hashed cuts up to 1CM deep, OK?!
- At this point, rub the Pork "Butts" with the dry spices (Cumin, Cinnamon, Cayenne +), salt, and achiote. The Achiote paste can also be mixed into a little bit of orange juice or pineapple juice to make it easier to rub in.
- In Deep Hotel Pans, place all of the butts in there with the Onions, Garlic, and wet ingredients (Water, Pineapple Juice, Orange Juice) - THEN - pre-heat your oven to 275-300 Degrees (F).
The level of the wet ingredients should come halfway up pork, add more water if need be. Wrap with foi
Cook for 4.5-7 hours. At 4 hours, you can check to see how this process is going.
Label/Date/Store!
Combine and mix.

- Using the Vitamix, take 1 can of Chipotle Peppers (In Adobo) and blitz them into a fine puree with this recipe's Lime Juice.
- Fold into Sour Cream and add Salt.
Label/Date/Store!

2. Half all Grape Tomatoes. You will notice in this recipe that 5 LBS is the measured amount require. This is because each box of Grape Tomatoes that comes in from Freshpoint is 10 LBS - meaning: use half of a box for this recipe. Easy enough?
3. Small Dice yellow Onions. Saute with Cumin and Cayenne, adding 1 Bag of Frozen Corn and Red Pepper to the mix along the way. Do not roast this Corn in the oven for any reason - its starches develop and it becomes tough texturally. Deglaze this mixture with Apple Cider Vinegar, and season.
- Pick Oregano. Don't bother picking the Cilantro, as some stem is fine in this recipe. Rough Chop both of these, and reserve to add into the rest of this recipe.

Notes:
This is a simple roast for the Burrito Bar, Bueno - all you need to know is that the Butternut Squash is to be peeled, seeded, and chopped up before roasting. A processed product will not be used in this recipe. Whenever possible, use as much UBC Squash as possible, as there will be an excess of it during the Fall/Winter season to use. UBC Squash cost in the system has been actualized to equal Freshpoint's cost.
Prep:
- Pre-heat Convection Oven to 375F/190C.
- Peel, Seed, and Chop Squash into 1" Cubes.
- Toss in Canola Oil, Salt, and Spices.
- Roast for 25 minutes, and then check! Alternatively, these Squash cubes can be steamed for 25-30 minutes, and then tossed in everything - Spices, Oil, Salt, AND Garlic - AND THEN finished in the Convection Oven.
- If you do not choose to steam the Squash beforehand, then only add the Garlic at the end of the roasting process - so as not to burn the Garlic.
- Roast until tender and cooked through - this will depend on the size of the cut / type of Squash - cool, and ready in the Bueno line in a hot-hold insert.
- Steam 2 Bags of the "7 Bean Medley" (Carb Freezer), and fold into the Roasted Squash as it cools.
- Label / Date / Store Appropriately...
Any Questions? - Ask Chef...

Method:
PREPARE THE FILLING:
1. Gather all ingredients
2. Preheat oven to 400F . lightly oil hotel pan (9x9")
3. Heat olive oil in rondeau. Add the onion, garlic, bell peppers,, cumin, and chili powder. Cook out untill the veggies are tender and the spices are toasted. 3-5 minutes aprox.

5. Blend the sour cream with the chipotle to make a sauce.
6. Cut the tortillas into 1/2" strips
ASSEMBLE:
1. Spread a little of the tomato sauce on the bottom. Layer half ot the tortila strips on the bottom to ensure full coverage allowing them to overlap.
2. Add half ot the veggie mix spreading out evenly. Drizzle the chipotle sour cream and half of the remaining tomato sauce. Spread evenly then sprinkle with half the cheese.
3. Repeat this layer again finishing with the reast of the cheese on top.
4. Cover with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 8-10 minutes. Until the casserole is hot and cooked all the way through and cheese is melted.
5. Allow to cool 5-10 minutes before cutting into squares.
6. Reserve for service / hot hold
